TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit ProtectedConfiguration extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides access to the protected-configuration providers for the current application's configuration file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration> class allows you to obtain information about the providers available to protect sensitive configuration data. You typically use the standard providers, but you can also create custom providers by deriving from the <xref:System.Configuration.ProtectedConfigurationProvider> class.
For more information about protected configuration, see [Encrypting Configuration Information Using Protected Configuration](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/51cdfe5b-9d82-458c-94ff-c551c4f38ed1).
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration> class to retrieve a collection of protected-configuration providers and discover their provider name, RSA provider name, and section names.
[!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration/CS/ProtectedConfiguration.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration/VB/ProtectedConfiguration.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: The name of the data protection provider.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This a constant string variable that contains the name of the data-protection provider made available by the system to protect a configuration section.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration.DataProtectionProviderName> property to retrieve the name of the current data-protection provider.
[!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration/CS/ProtectedConfiguration.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration/VB/ProtectedConfiguration.vb#4)]

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the default protected-configuration provider.
Docs.value: The name of the default protected-configuration provider.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default provider is identified by the `defaultProvider` attribute of the `<configProtectedData>` configuration-file element. The value must correspond to the name of one of the providers added in the `<providers>` subsection of the `<configProtectedData>` section. The `<configProtectedData>` section can also be accessed through an instance of the <xref:System.Configuration.ProtectedConfigurationSection> class.

Docs.summary: The name of the protected data section.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This is a constant string variable that contains the name of the protected data section.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration.ProtectedDataSectionName> property to retrieve the name of a protected data section.
[!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration/CS/ProtectedConfiguration.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration/VB/ProtectedConfiguration.vb#6)]

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of the installed protected-configuration providers.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration.Providers%2A> property to retrieve the collection of installed <xref:System.Configuration.ProtectedConfigurationProvider> objects.
[!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration/CS/ProtectedConfiguration.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration/VB/ProtectedConfiguration.vb#3)]

Docs.summary: The name of the RSA provider.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This a constant string variable that contains the name of the RSA provider made available by the system to protect a configuration section.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration.RsaProviderName> property to retrieve the name of the current RSA provider.
[!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration/CS/ProtectedConfiguration.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ProtectedConfiguration/VB/ProtectedConfiguration.vb#5)]
